reviews.review: buenisimo
Fun casual game. Great community. Fun after almost 1000 hours (almost 3 years). Would recommend!
İt seems valve kinda fixed the game. Perfect. Would recomend if they release the bot or heavy update.

Do you like edgy 12 year olds? Do you like the lenny face? Do you like shitty 2010 memes constantly spammed? Do you like cheaters in every other game you get into? Do you like having a nice shiny in game object that doesn't mean anything at all? Do you like horrible communities? THEN THIS GAME IS FOR YOU, GOOD SIR. I can tell you, over many hours of tf2, it's a good game. It's fun (sometimes) and exciting to get a cool looking character that you're happy with. Some of the matches can be right down to the bear bones and intense! 


Other times it's 9 aim bot amby spies running around with vac med bots following them, an aimbot sniper twitching and shooting everyone in the face over and over, spawn camping, really shitty memes being spammed, and little shitss who think they're the best thing since sliced bread. I like this game, don't get me wrong. Just the COMMUNITY as a whole is 20x worse than the CoD community. And that's saying something! I have only found a hand full of people in that game who were generally good players who didn't go out of their way to tilt you or make you quit. If you make someone quit, you're not good, you're not funny, you're a fu-king arse hole. Simple as that. When I made someone quit over constant killing, I didn't taunt, I didn't laugh, I didn't say how bad they were in chat. But everyone else in the game is just out to make every other decent players expierence absolutely horrible with a capital H. It's not fun to be spawn camped, it's not fun to be harrassed online because, hey, maybe you're just learning, maybe you're having a bad day and wanted to relax! NOPE! F YOU! NO FUN FOR YOU. QUE 12 SCOUTS AND ANOTHER 400 PYROS.


Now, the only good thing in this game I'd have to say is the cosmetics. That's it. You  get to make yourself look pretty. The game has a lot of bugs to work out still, for how long it's been alive. ( And i'm sure it has many more years. ) 


Overall, great game 8/10.
Community- 2/10.
I recommend this game, but attempt to turn off the chat box. I turned mine off and it made my games 4000x better.

If you want to play a team-based, casual and easy going or fast-paced competitive shooter, this is it. This game may be a decade old (more or less) but its still making a lasting impact and will never stop drawing new players while never stopping to entertain even the most seasoned players. This game is a real gem, will never stop having fun with it.

Adictivo, bien cuidado y divertido son las primeras palabras que me vienen a la mente con Team Fortress 2, el juego a crecido mucho con los años y supero mis expectativas al jugarlo por primera vez, quede muy complacido al ver que esta constantemente siendo revisado y el equipo esta al pendiente de cualquier inconveniencia o irregularidad que pueda afectar a los jugadores, al jugar la versión de consola y la de pc me di cuenta al instante del empeño que hay en la de pc ya que la de consola fue literalmente olvidada estando presente solo el juego base, por otro lado la comunidad sigue jugando y disfrutando del juego a pesar de ser tan simple en consola, recomendaría este juego cualquier dia a cualquier persona porque me a gustado mucho y la curva de aprendizaje no es complicada.

Big "no". I don't remember the balance in the rounds being this bad in the past, and I've had a long break. I've just had a few rounds in the payload mode that lasted probably 2-5 min- basically the minimum time for the carriage to reach the final checkpoint. People are bitching about autobalancers in EA games, but this? This is not even a joke.

I might play other games or even quit Team Fortress 2, but no matter what I do, I always find myself enyoing this juggernaut of gaming that is Team Fortress 2. Almost 10 years and the servers are still poppin' with old veterans and fresh blood from all over the world. It truely is a masterpiece. Try it out, it's free anyway. Trust me, you won't regret it
